summary: This is a stipulation filed in the Southern District of New York in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell (S2 20 CR 330). The parties agree that Government Exhibits 11-16 are true and correct certified copies of birth certificates from various jurisdictions and may be received as evidence at trial.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell

events.title: Filing of Stipulation on Birth Certificates
events.description: The prosecution and defense in the Ghislaine Maxwell case file a joint stipulation agreeing that Government Exhibits 11-16 (birth certificates) are true and correct certified copies and may be received as evidence at trial.

locations: Missouri Department of Health and Senior Services
General Register office of England and Wales
keyFacts: The prosecution and defense jointly stipulated to the authenticity of six birth certificates (Government Exhibits 11-16) for admission as evidence at Ghislaine Maxwell's trial.

The birth certificates originated from official agencies in New York, Rhode Island, Missouri, California, Massachusetts, and England/Wales, suggesting the victims or persons of interest were born in diverse locations.
The stipulation, marked as Government Exhibit 1004, was filed in November 2021 in the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of New York.
The document shows the legal team representing Ghislaine Maxwell at that time included attorneys Christopher Everdell, Laura Menninger, Jeffrey Pagliuca, and Bobbi Sternheim.
Damian Williams, the U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York, signed the stipulation on behalf of the government.
